title: PulseGeek
description: Tech news, gaming, and geek culture in one pulse

items.title: Zero-Shot vs Few-Shot Prompting: Accuracy, Control, and Cost Compared
items.content_text: Compare zero-shot vs few-shot prompting by accuracy, control, and cost. See tradeoffs, when to choose each, and practical guidance.

items.content_text: Learn what continuous compliance for AI systems means, how it works day to day, and how to monitor, evidence, and improve it.

items.title: What Does Permissionless Really Mean in Web3?

items.title: Upgradeable Smart Contracts: Proxies, Storage, Safety
items.content_text: Learn how to design upgradeable smart contracts using proxies, map storage safely, and run guarded upgrades with scripts, tests, and role checks.

items.title: Transaction Hash Explained: 7 Things You Should Know
items.content_text: Learn how a transaction hash works, why tiny input changes flip outputs, what collisions mean, how hashes link blocks, and how to verify one yourself.

items.content_text: Discover high‑impact IEC CIM use cases for utilities, from CGMES model exchange to ADMS integration and DER planning with IEEE 2030.5 mappings.

items.content_text: Design interoperable smart grid integration architecture from substation to cloud with IEC 61850, CIM, and IEEE 2030.5 reference patterns.

items.title: Smart Contracts in Rust: Pros, Cons, and Ecosystems
items.content_text: Compare Rust smart contract ecosystems across Solana, CosmWasm, and ink!. Learn benefits, limitations, tooling, and when Rust is the right language for your on-chain project.

items.title: Smart Contracts Explained: From Code to On-Chain Trust
items.content_text: Learn how smart contracts work, why they matter, and how to design, secure, and operate them from development through on-chain trust and real use cases.

items.title: Smart Contract Vulnerabilities: The Common Pitfalls
items.content_text: Explore frequent smart contract vulnerabilities with clear examples, tradeoffs, and fixes. Learn auditing habits, guard patterns, and tools to reduce risk before mainnet deployment.

items.title: Smart Contract Testing Best Practices That Catch Bugs

items.title: Smart Contract Security Pitfalls: 12 Gotchas to Avoid
items.content_text: Avoid common smart contract pitfalls with practical defenses. Learn to prevent reentrancy, integer issues, signature misuse, fragile oracles, and key management mistakes for safer on-chain transactions.

items.title: Smart Contract Lifecycle: Plan, Test, Deploy, Maintain
items.content_text: Learn the smart contract lifecycle from planning and specification to secure design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance, with pitfalls, patterns, and practical steps that reduce risk and improve on-chain reliability.

items.content_text: Learn core smart contract design patterns that improve reliability, upgradeability, and safe oracle interaction, with examples, tradeoffs, and practical checklists.

items.content_text: Learn smart contract auditing basics with a practical, stepwise checklist. Scope risks, set up tooling, spot common flaws, test assumptions, and ship safer code.

items.title: SHAP vs LIME: Choosing the Right Explanation Method
items.content_text: Compare SHAP and LIME across accuracy, stability, cost, and communication value. Learn when to choose each method and how to explain results.

items.title: SHA-256 in Blockchain: Why This Hash Still Matters
items.content_text: Learn how SHA-256 secures blockchains through preimage resistance, collision hardness, and hash-linked blocks. See why miners use double hashing and where alternatives like SHA-3 might fit next.

items.title: Setting Up an AI Oversight Committee, Step by Step
items.content_text: Learn how to set up an AI oversight committee with clear mandate, structure, workflows, and metrics for accountable governance.

items.content_text: A focused roadmap to improve SAIDI and SAIFI with data governance, grid‑edge automation, and cybersecurity, plus metrics that drive dependable gains.

items.title: Risks of AI in Education: Bias, Privacy, and Misuse

items.content_text: Define responsible AI KPIs and monitoring metrics, set fair thresholds, build dashboards, and connect alerts to governance and incident response.
